events.title: UGIS Commencement Ceremony Registration Opens
events.description: Registration opens for the Spring UGIS Commencement Ceremony for eligible graduates from Fall 2025, Spring 2026, Summer 2026, or Fall 2026.

events.title: PASAE Spring Semester General Meeting
events.organizer: Pilipinx Association of Scientists, Architects, and Engineers (PASAE)
events.description: The Pilipinx Association of Scientists, Architects, and Engineers (PASAE) holds its first general meeting of the Spring 2026 semester.

events.title: Albany Little League 2026 Spring Season Practices Begin
events.location: Local fields in Albany and Berkeley communities
events.description: Practices kick off for various levels of the Spring 2026 baseball season for youth ages 5-14.

events.title: Berkeley Rep Docent Talk: How Shakespeare Saved My Life
events.location: Mechanics' Institute, San Francisco (relevant to Berkeley community)
events.description: A docent talk from Berkeley Rep exploring the personal impact of Shakespeare.

events.title: What Farmworkers Told Us They Want to Learn from UC Cooperative Extension
events.organizer: Western Center for Agricultural Health and Safety (UC Davis, in collaboration with UC ANR)
events.description: Katherine Jarvis-Shean from UC Davis presents findings on farmworker learning preferences, part of the 2025-2026 seminar series.

events.title: Bridging the Gap Seminar: Cell Type-Specific Therapies for Parkinson's Disease
events.description: Ananya Chowdhury, PhD, will discuss cell type-specific therapies for Parkinson's Disease, as part of this translational neuroscience seminar series connecting UCSF, UC Berkeley, and other institutions.

events.title: 2026 Bay Area Networking Reception
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Goldman School of Public Policy
events.location: TBD, Bay Area (likely Berkeley Campus or nearby)
events.description: An annual event for Goldman School alumni, current graduate students, and prospective employers to connect and network.

events.title: Computer Science Department Colloquium: Innovations in AI Ethics
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences (EECS)
events.description: A weekly colloquium featuring a guest speaker discussing recent advancements and ethical considerations in Artificial Intelligence.

events.title: Career Center Workshop: Crafting an Effective Resume
events.description: Learn best practices for creating a compelling resume to stand out to employers and graduate programs.

events.title: BAMPFA Film Screening: Classic French New Wave
events.organizer: Berkeley Art Museum and Pacific Film Archive (BAMPFA)
events.description: A special screening of a seminal film from the French New Wave movement.

events.title: "Who's Flying This Thing?" US Military Action in Venezuela & Latin America
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Goldman School of Public Policy, Institute of International Studies
events.description: A discussion on U.S. military involvement in Venezuela, the 'Donroe' Doctrine, and its broader implications for U.S. relations with Latin America.

events.title: Dr. Kevin Bustamante: The Myth of Nuclear Prestige
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Goldman School of Public Policy
events.description: Dr. Kevin Bustamante presents his research on nuclear weapons as international status symbols.

events.title: KTH–UC Berkeley Summer Research Exchange Programme Decision
events.description: Decisions for the KTH–UC Berkeley Summer Research Exchange Programme are announced in early February.

events.title: Venezuela in Context: A Q&A on Policy and the US Military
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Goldman School of Public Policy
events.description: An event with Professor Dorothy Kronick to deepen understanding of current developments in Venezuela.

events.title: UC Berkeley Online MPH Information Session: Health Policy & Management
events.organizer: UC Berkeley School of Public Health
events.description: An information session for prospective students interested in the Online Master of Public Health program with a focus on Health Policy & Management, featuring Dr. Brent Fulton.

events.title: Focus On Local and State Government: Master of Public Affairs (MPA) Information Session
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Goldman School of Public Policy
events.description: An information session for prospective students interested in the Master of Public Affairs (MPA) program, focusing on careers in local and state government.

events.title: 2026 Cal Invitational Speech and Debate Tournament
events.description: The annual Cal Invitational featuring various speech and debate events for high school students. Continues through Feb 16.

events.title: Inclusive Excellence Summer Research Experience Application Deadline
events.description: Final deadline to submit applications for the Inclusive Excellence Summer Research Experience program.

events.title: KTH–UC Berkeley Summer Research Exchange Programme Document Preparation
events.description: Preparation and submission of necessary documents to UC Berkeley for accepted participants of the KTH–UC Berkeley Summer Research Exchange Programme.

events.title: Dr. Maxime Polleri: Radioactive Governance in Post-Fukushima Japan
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Goldman School of Public Policy
events.description: Dr. Maxime Polleri discusses the politics of revitalization and governance in Japan following the Fukushima disaster.

events.title: Inclusive Excellence Summer Research Experience Interviews Begin
events.description: Semifinalist interviews and admission decisions commence for the Inclusive Excellence Summer Research Experience.

events.title: 2026 Youth Winter League (Ultimate Frisbee) Final Day
events.location: Gilman Turf Field North (Tom Bates Sports Complex), Berkeley
events.description: The final day of the eight-week ultimate frisbee league for elementary and middle school students.

events.title: 2026 Clark Kerr Lectures: Evolving Conditions

events.description: President Eisgruber delivers the first Clark Kerr Lecture, focusing on major trends impacting American research universities.

events.title: MPA Career Services Overview & Alumni Panel

events.description: An overview of career services for MPA students, followed by a panel discussion with program alumni.

events.title: 2026 Clark Kerr Lectures: Contested Missions

events.description: President Eisgruber's second Clark Kerr Lecture, examining the civic mission of research universities and leadership challenges.
